intro: Craspidospermum verticillatum var. sessile, commonly known as the sessile craspidospermum, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its clustered, hairy leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. This variety is notable for its compact growth habit and ornamental value in gardens.
